availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sally Wilkerson McKee. Father of John McKee, Elizabeth McKee, Samuel McKee, Melvin McKee, Mary McKee, Moses McKee, Asena McKee, James McKee, Sally McKee, and Henry McKee. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 9B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 33.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 226.
